strings:
1. Cards that are face up and showing may be moved from the stock pile or the columns to the foundation stacks or to other columns 

2. To move a card to a column, it must be one less in rank and the opposite color. For example, if it was a 9 of hearts (red), you could put an 8 of spades or clubs onto it. Stacks of cards may be moved from one column to another as long as they maintain the same order (highest to lowest, alternating colors).

3. If you get an empty column, you can start a new column with a King. Any new column must be started with a King (or a stack of cards that starts with a King).

4. To get new cards from the stock pile, you turn one card at a time face up into the stack next to the stock pile called the waist stack. You can only play the top card off the waist stack. If you run out of stock cards, turn the waist stack over to make a new stock pile and start again, pulling the top three cards off, turning them over, and starting a new waist stack.

1. Cards that are face up and showing may be moved from the stock pile or the columns to the foundation stacks or to other columns.

2. To move a card to a column, it must be one less in rank and the opposite color. For example, if it was a 9 of hearts (red), you could put an 8 of spades or clubs onto it. Stacks of cards may be moved from one column to  another as long as they maintain the same order (highest to lowest, alternating colors). 

3. If you get an empty column, you can start a new column with a King. Any new column must be started with a King (or a stack of cards that starts with a King).

4. To get new cards from the stock pile, you turn one card at a time face up into the stack next to the stock pile called the waist stack. You can only play the top card off the waist stack. If you run out of stock cards, turn the waist stack over to make a new stock pile and start again, pulling the top three cards off, turning them over, and starting a new waist stack.

1. L'objectif est de former 4 piles de cartes pour chaque symboles (Pique, Cœur, Carreau, Trèfle) par ordre croissant (de l'As au Roi).

2.Si vous obtenez une colonne vide, vous pouvez commencer une nouvelle colonne avec un roi. Toute nouvelle colonne doit commencer par un roi (ou une pile de cartes commençant par un roi).

3. Pour déplacer une carte dans une colonne, celle-ci doit avoir un rang de moins et la couleur opposée. Par exemple, si vous tirez un 9 de cœur (rouge), vous pouvez mettre un 8 de pique ou de trèfle dessus.  Les piles de cartes peuvent être déplacées d'une colonne à une autre tant qu'elles conservent le même ordre.

4. Si vous n'avez plus d'actions disponibles, vous pouvez utiliser la pile de réserve
